oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREDICTING CHANGES IN THE PLAN SHAPE OF BEACHES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Price, W.A.
Tomlinson, K.W.
Willis, D.H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: prediction
plan shape
beach shape
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A mathematical model is described that is capable of predicting changes in the plan shape of a beach following the construction of sea defences or an alteration in the wave climate. The rate of change is calculated. The technique is illustrated by comparing model predictions with results from experiments carried out in a wave basin. The importance of the method in estimating coastal changes due to offshore dredging is mentioned, and the future development of the mathematical approach is outlined.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 13 (1972): Proceedings of 13th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Vancouver, Canada, 1972.; 68
